About Us.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we are the CSU Chads, a dynamic team of six innovators ready to tackle the challenges of this hackathon with creativity and determination.

“A Window to the ISS (International Spac.text: the website we've created is an interactive 3D map of lunar seismic activity, seamlessly blending space exploration and data visualization to offer users a captivating and educational journey through the Moon's geophysical phenomena, complete with dynamic features, informative data representation, and valuable context for a diverse audience ranging from students to space enthusiasts.

initial.text: Provide an interactive 3D map of the seismic activity on the moon
Map the coordinates on the moon where seismic activity was measured
Using geolocation of the user and information regarding the ISS orbit, provide an augmented reality tool that can locate the ISS in the sky when it is overhead of the user.

planned.text: The current solution uses WebXR which is only supported by Chrome and FireFox browsers on Android devices.

planned.header: AR Ground View Pointers and Orbit Lines
planned.text: Create and improve optional orbit lines and locator arrow features that would assist the user in moving their AR view into an orientation where the ISS comes into view.
Integrate visibility data and push notifications to send reminders and alert the user to times when the ISS is viewable without a telescope.
Take photos and videos of the ISS and share them with your friends on various social media platforms.
Use various available models to provide a 3D tour of the ISS with call outs for the various modules with information on their usage.

A game that challenges the user to find an interactive cartoon wrench character hidden in the 3D tour of the ISS. The wrench character will then describe life and activities associated with the location of the wrench.

Tools:.name: GitHub - Code Version Control and Hosting
